Name: Chhavi Pathania

It has SAC (Student Activity Centre) which has a gym with the latest equipment and experienced trainers. Also, it has courts for sports like badminton, TT, chess, boxing, etc.

Name: Diptorshi Tripathi

All classrooms are equipped with projectors and whiteboards, and almost all classrooms seat 70-80 students, other than the gallery classrooms, which seat 150 students. There are a lot of extra curricular activites on the campus. Besides a massive football court and cricket field, there are two basketball courts, a tennis court, a volleyball court, a badminton court, and a squash room. Coaches come regularly to teach arts like karate and boxing too. There are several clubs in here as well, and opting for a technical club (like CSI or ACM) gives you credits.

Review: I am in the 2nd year of b.com hons. programme and it has six semesters that cover topics including accounting,  business, marketing, human resource management, income tax and audit. I joined the course as I have a great interest in business and marketing. The course material is created to offer a broad variety of knowledge in several disciplines including Finance and Economics. The faculty-to-student ratio is around 1:24. Highly qualified professors with PhD or Master's degrees make up the faculty. Her teaching techniques range from blackboard to laptops. Exams are given twice a year, semester by semester and are of moderate complexity. Students are not always industry-ready after doing the degree but it does prepare them for specialising in their chosen subject. Overall, the b.com. Hons. programme offers a strong learning environment with a focus on theoretical and practical knowledge, as well as ample opportunities for students to clear their doubts with professors.

Name: Yadav Vikas Rajeshbhai
Heading: IIM Sirmaur General MBA Review
Review: After finishing my BBA which gave me theoretical knowledge about the business world MBA would help me grow in practical aspects and prepare me for the industry. The faculty-student ratio at IIM Sirmaur is about 1:50, although students can interact with any faculty they want. The faculties are approachable and helpful. Most faculties have PHD in their respective fields, and case based approach is used for teaching. The examination schedule is provided right at the start of the academic year. There is a midterm to be given after one and a half months of the term and an end term to be given at the end of the 3rd month of the term. The evaluation criteria include class participation, project, individual/group assignments, and presentations. Thus a student must devote time and effort to score good marks.
